snippet: The legislation will limit the ability of cities to profit from traffic tickets, a move meant to address concerns raised after the fatal police shooting of Michael Brown.
abstract: Missouri Gov Jay Nixon signs law aimed at curbing amount of money cities can collect from traffic fines; move is prompted by Justice Dept report showing that predatory revenue-generating practices contribute to distrust and racial tensions between generally white police force and predominantly black communities.
lead_paragraph: The legislation will limit the ability of cities to profit from traffic tickets, a move meant to address concerns raised after the fatal police shooting of Michael Brown.

headline.main: Missouri: Governor Signs Curbs on Profits From Traffic Tickets
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Governor Signs Curbs on Profits From Traffic Tickets
